ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: When you were growing up, during your first 18 years of life...Did you have at least one caregiver with whom you felt safe?
When you were growing up, during your first 18 years of life...Did you have at least one good friend?
When you were growing up, during your first 18 years of life...Did you have beliefs that gave you comfort?
When you were growing up, during your first 18 years of life...Did you like school?
When you were growing up, during your first 18 years of life...Did you have at least one teacher who cared about you?
When you were growing up, during your first 18 years of life...Did you have good neighbors?
When you were growing up, during your first 18 years of life...Was there an adult (not a parent/caregiver or the person from the first question) who could provide you with support or advice?
When you were growing up, during your first 18 years of life...Did you have opportunities to have a good time?
When you were growing up, during your first 18 years of life...Did you like yourself or feel comfortable with yourself?
When you were growing up, during your first 18 years of life...Did you have a predictable home routine, like regular meals and a regular bedtime?
